descripcion: The Pilot Version - The very first attempt at televising the QI format. No titles, background photos or set design as we later knew from the following Commissioned Series version. Its possible this Pilot was recorded relatively cheaply, unedited, "as live", as Stephen Fry refers to running out of tape, as the banter gets quite anarchic, and the running time hits 35 minutes, instead of the later tight 30 minutes.
Stephen discusses various topics beginning with 'A', including Adam's navel, with his guests Danny Baker, Hugh Laurie and John Sessions.
Stephen discusses all things astronomical with his guests Bill Bailey, Rich Hall and Jeremy Hardy.
Stephen discusses various aquatic animals with his guests Clive Anderson, Bill Bailey and Meera Syal.

Stephen Fry hosts the almost impossible quiz show with guests Alan Davies, Jo Brand, Howard Goodall and Jeremy Hardy. The theme of this edition of the show is atoms and questions range from Argentina to the composition of air.
Stephen Fry hosts the challenging quiz in which points are awarded. Alan Davies, Rob Brydon, Rich Hall and Gyles Brandreth face questions related to advertising - from Aristotle to alcoholics.
Stephen discusses all things 'A' with his guests Danny Baker, Jo Brand and Howard Goodall, including various antidotes for ailments.
Stephen discusses all things arthropods with his guests Jo Brand, Jimmy Carr and Jackie Clune.
Stephen Fry's discusses what his sporty ancestor have to do with Albania, along with other things beginning with 'A' with his guests Alan Davies, Clive Anderson, Sean Lock, Linda Smith.
Stephen discusses all things African with his guests Alan Davies, Jo Brand, Dave Gorman and Jeremy Hardy.
Stephen discusses all things aviation with his guests Alan Davies, Rich Hall, Julia Morris and Peter Serafinowicz.

Stephen Fry poses questions on the topic of arts to Alan Davies, Linda Smith, Bill Bailey and Richard E. Grant. Questions in this edition include - who invented the telephone and what is the most dangerous animal in Africa?

Stephen Fry hosts a festive edition of the quiz show. Alan Davies, Sean Lock, John Sessions and Phill Jupitus attempt to identify the gender of Rudolf the reindeer and guess which Christmas decoration a German village exported worldwide.

Colourful host Stephen Fry quizzes contestants Alan Davies, Jo Brand, Bill Bailey and Sean Lock on the topic of blue. Questions on butterflies, beetles and baguettes feature including - what rhymes with orange?

Our feathered friends are the subject of this edition of the quite interesting quiz. Stephen Fry asks the questions as Alan Davies, Jo Brand, Phil Kay and Rich Hall forget everything they thought they knew about birds, bills and brothers.

Guests Alan Davies, Clive Anderson, Phill Jupitus and Rich Hall try to avoid being damp squibs as they face questions on the topic of bombs. Host Stephen Fry lights the blue touch paper in an explosive edition of the quiz show.

Brainy host Stephen Fry delves deep into the world of bizarre Biblical arcana with guests Alan Davies, Jeremy Hardy, Barry Cryer and Jeremy Clarkson. Including questions on baldness and Andy Warhol's underwear.

Jimmy Carr, Bill Bailey, Jo Brand and Alan Davies answer questions on bears, bulbs and bamboo posed by host Stephen Fry. Featuring the memorable moment when Jimmy Carr arranges the letters on a board into a strange but true sentence.

Bantermeisters Alan Davies, Anneka Rice, Sean Lock and Bill Bailey beaver away to impress host Stephen Fry with their knowledge of the topic of beavers. Bulges, bacteria and the Pope's Friday meal are also the subject of questions.

Biscuits, ballet and baboons are on the agenda as Stephen Fry host another edition of the challenging quiz show. Alan Davies, Arthur Smith, Dara O'Briain and Rich Hall are the guests trying to avoid the obvious answers.

Stephen Fry hosts the quiz show in which contestants are rewarded more if their answers are 'quite interesting'. With Alan Davies, Jo Brand, Fred Macaulay and Rich Hall. Bees, barnacles and basketball are subjects on the agenda.
Host Stephen Fry and guests Alan Davies, Josie Lawrence, John Sessions and Rich Hall tackle the subjects of butterflies, blackberries and Bernards.

Stephen Fry hosts the quiz show in which contestants are rewarded more if their answers are 'quite interesting'. Clive Anderson, Phil Kay, John Sessions and Alan Davies on the subjects of Bills, Bens and buildings.
Stephen Fry hosts the quiz show in which contestants are rewarded if their answers are 'quite interesting'. With Mark Gatiss, Sean Lock, Linda Smith and Alan Davies.
Christmas special. Stephen Fry chairs a festive version of the almost impossible quiz with guests Alan Davies, Mark Steel, Phill Jupitus and Rich Hall.
Host Stephen Fry and guests Alan Davies, Bill Bailey, Rob Brydon and Rich Hall tackle the subject of campanology.
Host Stephen Fry and guests Doon Mackichan, Arthur Smith, Andy Hamilton and Alan Davies attempt to answer impossible questions based around the subject of cummingtonite.

Stephen Fry hosts the quiz show in which contestants are rewarded more if their answers are 'quite interesting'. Today's subjects include chickens, cormorants and cardigans. With Jimmy Carr, Rory McGrath, Sean Lock and Alan Davies.

Stephen Fry hosts the quiz in which contestants are rewarded more if their answers are 'quite interesting'. Subjects include cheating, caravans and cuckoo clocks. With Jeremy Clarkson, Alexander Armstrong, John Sessions and Alan Davies.

Stephen Fry hosts the quiz show in which contestants are rewarded more if their answers are 'quite interesting'. Subjects include cat's-eyes, camels and centurions. With Rich Hall, Sean Lock, Jo Brand and Alan Davies.

Stephen Fry hosts the quiz show in which contestants are rewarded more if their answers are 'quite interesting'. Subjects include cockneys, catfish and coal. With Bill Bailey, Rory McGrath, Phill Jupitus and Alan Davies.

Stephen Fry hosts the quiz show in which contestants are rewarded more if their answers are 'quite interesting'. Subjects include chihuahuas, cheese and constellations. With Jeremy Clarkson, Rich Hall, Sean Lock and Alan Davies.

Actor, author and national treasure Stephen Fry hosts the quiz show in which contestants are rewarded more if their answers are 'quite interesting'. This time, china, Corby and coffee are the topics under discussion.

Stephen Fry hosts the quiz in which guests are rewarded if their answers are 'quite interesting'. This edition's subjects include chimps, chromosomes and cuttlefish. Stars Helen Atkinson Wood, Bill Bailey, Andy Hamilton and Alan Davies.

Stephen Fry hosts the quiz show in which contestants are rewarded more if their answers are 'quite interesting'. Subjects include corks, cats and carbon dioxide. Panellists are Clive Anderson, Mark Steel, John Sessions and Alan Davies.

Stephen Fry hosts the quiz show in which contestants are rewarded more if their answers are 'quite interesting'. Fry probes clowns, cuckoos and Cinderella with panellists Clive Anderson, Jo Brand, Phill Jupitus and Alan Davies.

Stephen Fry hosts the quiz show in which contestants are rewarded more if their answers are 'quite interesting'. Subjects include catastrophes, cosmonauts and coconuts, with Bill Bailey, Dara O'Briain, Phill Jupitus and Alan Davies.

This edition features guests Alan Davies, Liza Tarbuck, Jeremy Clarkson and Neil Mullarkey sniffing around the subject of dogs.
This edition features Alan Davies, Phill Jupitus, Ronni Ancona and Rory Bremner tackling the subject of dictionaries.
This edition features Alan Davies, Sean Lock, Andy Parsons and Clive Anderson gravely tackling the subject of death.
This edition features Alan Davies, John Sessions, Phill Jupitus and Jimmy Carr taking a swig and answer questions on the subject of drinking.
Host Stephen Fry and guests Alan Davies, Julian Clary, Jo Brand and Dara O'Briain try and find common ground in this edition dedicated to the topic of differences.

Host Stephen Fry and guests David Mitchell, Andy Hamilton, John Sessions and Alan Davies get to grips with doves.

Host Stephen Fry and guests Jo Brand, Jessica Stevenson, Alan Davies and Phill Jupitus make themselves at home discussing the topic of domesticity.
Stephen Fry hosts the quiz show in which contestants are rewarded more if their answers are 'quite interesting'. Christmas special with Jo Brand, Rich Hall, Alan Davies and Dara O Briain.

Bill Bailey, Rich Hall, Sean Lock and Alan Davies answer questions on some quite interesting explorations.
Phill Jupitus, Dara O'Briain, David Mitchell and Alan Davies get continental in this Europe themed episode.
Alan Davies, Clive Anderson, Jeremy Clarkson and Vic Reeves discuss absolutely everything.

Masterful host Stephen Fry rules the really rather interesting quiz with an iron fist as he questions guests Alan Davies, Bill Bailey, Sean Lock and Jo Brand on the subject of empires. Will the teasing questions leave them in a state?
As per request of "young Alan Davies", Santa, A.K.A Stephen Fry, brings him a compilation show of some of the funniest moments of the season, with some unseen footage.

Stephen Fry quizzes Phill Jupitus, Jo Brand, Hugh Dennis and Alan Davies on all things French, and their answers must be interesting if they are to score points.

Stephen Fry and his guests get gladiatorial in this edition of the quiz when they tackle the topic of games. Regular player Alan Davies is joined by challengers Phill Jupitus, Sean Lock and Liza Tarbuck.

Comedy quiz show where the guests get points for being interesting. Stephen Fry guarantees you a groovy Christmas, with David Tennant, Bill Bailey, Lee Mack and Alan Davies.

Genial host Stephen Fry ponders the topic of genius with guests Graham Norton, David Mitchell, Dara O'Briain and Alan Davies. Even simple questions such as "How old are you?" can be a cause of consternation in this quiz show.

Comedy quiz show where the guests get more points for being interesting. Stephen Fry gladly gravitates towards Germany. He is joined by Jo Brand, Rob Brydon, Sean Lock and Alan Davies.

Quiz show where guests get more points for being interesting. Stephen Fry gets to grips with the greats, with Jo Brand, David Mitchell, Sean Lock and Alan Davies.

In this edition of the quite interesting quiz show genial host Stephen Fry bestows his knowledge of gifts upon Alan Davies, Clive Anderson, Jimmy Carr and Jan Ravens as they attempt to accumulate point-based presents.

"What's the use of an underwater weighing machine?" and "Why did Fosbury flop?" are some of the questions floated by host Stephen Fry as guests Barry Humphries, Bill Bailey, Rich Hall and Alan Davies are pressed on the topic of gravity.

Where is the Duchy of Cornwall? What does a cowboy call his rope? These are amongst the quite interesting questions host Stephen Fry will put to his guests Jo Brand, Colin Lane, David Mitchell and Alan Davies on the topic of landmarks.

Stephen discusses merriment with his guests Alan Davies, Bill Bailey, Jenny Eclair and Johnny Vegas in this Christmas themed episode.

Stephen Fry meditates on matters medieval and macabre with Alan Davies, Julia Zemiro, Matt Lucas and David Mitchell.
Panellists Sarah Millican, Eddie Kadi, Noel Fielding and Alan Davies muck about as host Stephen Fry tests them with questions on a messy mixture of matters.
Host Stephen Fry matches wits with guests Alan Davies, Bill Bailey, Jo Brand and James Acaster, quizzing them on a mixed-up melange of M-themed topics.

A new era of QI begins with regular guest Sandi Toksvig taking the helm for her first show as QI-Master. She will be Naming Names with Cariad Lloyd, Phil Jupitus, Romesh Ranganathan and of course Alan Davies.

New QI-Master Sandi Toksvig will feel right at home as she looks at the North, the Norse and all things Nordic with guests Jason Mountford, Lucy Beaumont, Rhod Gilbert and regular panellist Alan Davies.
Sandi Toksvig hosts a nosey, noisy episode of the quite interesting panel show with guests Aisling Bea, Ross Noble, Slipknot lead singer Corey Taylor and of course regular panellist Alan Davies.
Guests Jeremy Clarkson, Jason Manford and Sara Pascoe join Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig for another edition of the quiz, this time on the intriguing subject of noble rot.
Sandi Toksvig hosts another edition of the interesting quiz. Regular panellist Alan Davies is joined by Gyles Brandreth, Victoria Coren Mitchell and Jimmy Carr to contemplate not nearly.
David Mitchell, Noel Fielding and Holly Walsh join regular Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig for an edition of the popular quiz show aiming to shine a light on the topic of the night.
Guests Lolly Adefope, Lee Mack and Richard Osman join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig for another edition of the popular quiz, this time covering the naked truth.
Host Sandi Toksvig looks at some non sequiturs with regular panellist Alan Davies and guests Phill Jupitus, Miles Jupp and Deirdre O'Kane in the quite interesting quiz.
Sandi Toksvig hosts the Christmas Special. Regular participant Alan Davies and guests Matt Lucas, Susan Calman and Josh Widdicombe will have a merry old time looking at all things related to Noel.
Ross Noble, Cariad Lloyd and David Baddiel join Sandi and Alan to discuss the topic of nature and nurture in another edition of the quite interesting quiz.
Sandi Toksvig hosts the amusingly informative quiz. Guests Nish Kumar, Phill Jupitus and Holly Walsh join regular Alan Davies to talk nonsense.
Sandi Toksvig is joined by Matt Lucas, Jerry Springer, Cariad Lloyd and regular Alan Davies, to natter about noodles.
Sandi Toksvig is joined by Jimmy Carr, Johnny Vegas, Ronni Ancona and regular Alan Davies to natter about naval navigation matters.
Sandi Toksvig and Alan Davies are joined by guests Noel Fielding, Sarah Millican and Colin Lane to get their collective heads around the topic of numbers.
Guests Frankie Boyle, Ross Noble and Lucy Porter join Alan Davies on the panel as Sandi Toksvig hosts the Next edition of the show.
New host Sandi Toksvig and regular Alan Davies are joined by guests Jo Brand, Clive Anderson and Jimmy Carr for the final episode of the new series, dealing with the subject of new.

Sandi Toksvig returns to host her second series of the quite interesting quiz. Regular panellist Alan Davies is joined by Bill Bailey, Phill Jupitus and Claudia Winkleman.

Sandi Toksvig helms another edition of the quiz. Joining regular crew member Alan Davies are landlubbers Aisling Bea, Joe Lycett and David Mitchell.
Artist Grayson Perry, impressionist Jan Ravens and comedian Bill Bailey hope to bowl over Sandi and Alan with their answers and not end up with egg on their faces.
Why is the world's second-smallest man so frustrated? will be among the topics as Sandi and Alan discuss all things Odorous and Odious with Sally Phillips, Nish Kumar and Ross Noble.
